p: Assuming unchanged nutrient availability, Arctic sympagic gross primary production (GPP) in first-year ice is projected to overall increase in the future (i.e., from 2.47 to 4.02 Tg C y âˆ’1, that is, 63%; Fig. 3 and table S2), indicating an increased uptake of carbon dioxide and thus an overall increase of the carbon biological pump. However, the response of the biological community to quasi-linear latitudinal changes in sea-ice physical drivers of Fig. 2 is markedly nonlinear.
